job_description: We begin with dreams. Dreams drive our motivation. Dreams are our future. The world's dreams, people's dreams, our dreams. Our passion creates ideas that make dreams come alive. Technology and products that were only dreams become reality.All for dreams. Dreams challenge and the Nidec-Group will continue to meet the challenge. For the world's and people's tomorrows; the world's first, the world's best technologies and products; we will continue our part in creating a better society.Job SummaryJob DescriptionSUMMARY OF ROLEThe Sales & Pricing Data Analyst plays a critical role in driving data-informed decision-making by developing and maintaining dashboards, analyzing sales performance, and delivering actionable insights across the organization.This role involves deep collaboration with sales, marketing, finance, and executive teams to assess trends, forecast outcomes, and evaluate the effectiveness of strategic initiatives.A key focus includes conducting pricing analysis to understand market positioning, optimize profitability, and support pricing strategy development through data modeling and scenario analysis.The ideal candidate combines strong technical skills in tools such as Power BI, Oracle EBS, Excel, and Salesforce with a keen analytical mindset and the ability to clearly communicate complex insights to stakeholders.______________________________________________________________SPECIFIC JOB RESPONSIBILITIESResponsibilities:Develop, maintain, and enhance dashboards and reports using Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS), Power BI, Excel, and Salesforce.Analyze booking and sales data to provide actionable insights and support strategic decision-making.Assess sales data for the organization, including examining monthly, quarterly, and annual sales reports to identify sales patterns and areas for improvement.Compare actual sales data to revenue projections and expectations.Utilize previous sales data and market trends to develop forecasts and projections.Develop reports showing expected sales and the potential effects of new strategies to aid in decision-making.Work closely with marketing, sales, and management personnel to develop forecasts and examine the potential revenue effects of various proposals.Conduct quantitative analysis including but not limited to ROI, trending, identification and assessment of opportunity and risk, forecasting, regressions, correlation, cannibalization, and probability modeling.Regularly prepare internal reports and presentations for executives and other company leaders, including data on market performance, competitor research, and general sales trends.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data solutions.Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources to ensure data accuracy and integrity.Perform data validation and quality checks to ensure the reliability of reports and dashboards.Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to support business objectives.Create and maintain documentation for data processes, reports, and dashboards.Analyze pricing strategies and their impact on sales performance and profitability.Monitor price elasticity and customer response to pricing changes across different product lines and regions.Evaluate competitive pricing and market positioning to identify opportunities for margin improvement.Support pricing decisions with data-driven insights and scenario modeling.Collaborate with finance and product teams to assess cost structures and recommend optimal pricing strategies.Develop pricing dashboards and tools to track pricing trends, discounting behavior, and promotional effectiveness.Conduct post-implementation analysis of pricing initiatives to measure success and inform future strategies.______________________________________________________________CustomersWorks with internal and external customers on a regular basis.TravelOccasionally______________________________________________________________Education and QualificationsBachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a focus on dashboarding and reporting.Proficiency in Oracle EBS, Power BI, Excel, and Salesforce.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent communication and collaboration skills.Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.Communication: Ability to clearly convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.Collaboration: Strong team player who can work effectively with cross-functional teams.Problem-Solving: Proactive in identifying issues and developing innovative solutions.Adaptability: Flexible and open to change in a fast-paced environment.Time Management: Efficient in managing multiple tasks and meeting deadlines.Critical Thinking: Ability to analyze data critically and provide insights to executives and other company leaders to aid in their making data-driven decisions.Attention to Detail: Meticulous in ensuring data accuracy and quality.Preferred QualificationsExperience with other data visualization tools and programming languages (e.g., SQL, VB, Python).Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and best practices.Additional Job DetailsProfessional – P1Organizational Impact• Works to achieve operational, functional, and/or business targets within job area with indirect impact on departmental or job family results• Entry-level professional; follows standard processes and works under close supervision• Work is defined by others within smaller, less complex projects/assignments and generally more limited in scopeCommunication & Influence• Communicates with contacts typically within the team on matters that involve obtaining or providing information requiring some explanation or interpretation in order to reach agreementInnovation & Complexity• May be responsible for contributing to recommended enhancements in systems and processes to solve problems or improve effectiveness within job area• Problems are routine, but may require interpretation or deviation from standard proceduresLeadership & Talent Management• N/A – Jobs at this level are focused on self-developmentKnowledge & Experience• Requires broad theoretical job knowledge typically obtained through advanced education; may have limited to no experienceEqual Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at NidecNidec is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, genetic information, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information regarding your (EEO) rights as an applicant, please visit the following website: http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdfWork Shift ScheduleNo SolicitingNidec will not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies in response to Nidec job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers. Pre-approval from the Nidec Talent Acquisition team is required before any external candidate can be submitted and such candidate must be submitted to the Nidec Talent Acquisition team.

</br><b>Job Description </b></br><p>Do you want to design and write software that really matters and be a part of a cause greater than yourself? Then, help us protect those that protect us by developing Next Generation Electronic Systems Products and Solutions. We need your talent, motivation, and vision to join our Long Island team. We are actively seeking an Entry Level Software Engineer with a range of skills and a passion for learning new things who can apply their skills to developing high-quality, real-time embedded software for fielded electronics platforms. BAE Systems in Greenlawn, NY has recently been awarded new programs and is currently undergoing an exciting period of growth.<br><br>When you become a member of our team, you will work across multiple disciplines and collaborate with Systems, Hardware and Test Engineers to impact all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle. At BAE Systems, we promote a strong, collaborative culture and provide our employees with the tools, skills and training they need to succeed. We are all about trust, camaraderie and a shared ambition to lead the world in defense technologies and national security services. We offer a flexible work environment and 9/80 work schedule. Our company is part of the community, and driven to improve our future and protect our freedom.<br><br>Because this role involves a combination of collaborative/in-person and independent work, it will take the form of a hybrid work format, with time split between working onsite and remotely.</p></br></br><b>Required Education, Experience, & Skills </b></br><section data-ph-id="ph-page-element-page66-UlF6QY" data-tmpl-type="inline" instance-id="ev3ljc" original-view="job-desc" view="ev3ljc-job-desc"><ul dir="ltr"><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or other scientific degree with strong software content.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills that translate to working, maintainable software.</li><li>Able to obtain a Secret clearance.</li></ul></section><br></br></br><b>Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills </b></br><section data-ph-id="ph-page-element-page66-UlF6QY" data-tmpl-type="inline" instance-id="ev3ljc" original-view="job-desc" view="ev3ljc-job-desc"><ul><li>Demonstrated proficiency in a high level software language such as Java, C++, C, or Python </li><li>Coursework or other experience in embedded software development. </li><li>Working knowledge of software tools such as Jira, BitBucket, debuggers, containers, etc.</li><li>Experience with Agile Development and DevSecOps</li><li>Experience developing on Windows/Linux Operating Systems</li><li>Experience using git or another version control system </li><li>Familiarity with Unit Testing frameworks</li><li>Active Secret Clearance</li></ul></section><br><br><br><b>Pay Information</b><br>Full-Time Salary Range: $69439 - $118047<br><br>Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience. <br><br>Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.<br></br></br><b>About BAE Systems Electronic Systems </b></br>BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve.<br><br>This position will be posted for at least 5 calendar days. The posting will remain active until the position is filled, or a qualified pool of candidates is identified.
Join NVIDIA in this exciting opportunity.

This is an early-career position where you’ll gain hands-on experience building frontend features, fixing bugs, and learning modern web development practices. You will work with senior engineers and cross-functional partners to deliver customer-first solutions that simplify financial workflows for millions of small businesses.


Responsibilities

  • Implement simple UI features or bug fixes using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS within established architecture.
  • Collaborate with senior engineers, designers, and product managers in an agile development team.
  • Write well-documented, testable code and participate in code reviews.
  • Assist in integrating frontend components with backend APIs and services.
  • Debug and resolve defects with guidance from more experienced engineers.
  • Learn and apply engineering best practices such as test-driven development (TDD), accessibility, and responsive design.
  • Gain exposure to the Fintech domain, including customer experiences related to invoicing, payments, and money movement.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Academic or personal project experience with frontend technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS).
  • Understanding of basic programming concepts, version control, and software testing.
  • Willingness to learn secure software development practices and CI/CD workflows.
  • Strong problem-solving mindset and a collaborative, growth-oriented attitude.
  • Familiarity with any JavaScript SPA framework (e.g., React, Angular, Vue) is a plus.

Intuit provides a competitive compensation package with a strong pay for performance rewards approach. This position will be eligible for a cash bonus, equity rewards and benefits, in accordance with our applicable plans and programs (see more about our compensation and benefits at Intuit®: Careers | Benefits). Pay offered is based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and work location. To drive ongoing fair pay for employees, Intuit conducts regular comparisons across categories of ethnicity and gender. The expected base pay range for this position is: 

Bay Area California $ 55.50- 75.00

About Anthropic Anthropic’s mission is to create reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems. We want AI to be safe and beneficial for our users and for society as a whole. Our team is a quickly growing group of committed researchers, engineers, policy experts, and business leaders working together to build beneficial AI systems.About the role As a Sales Manager at Anthropic, you'll lead a team of Enterprise Account Executives driving the adoption of safe, frontier AI by securing strategic deals within the Insurance industry. You'll leverage your leadership and consultative sales expertise within Insurance to propel revenue growth while developing a high-performing team of AEs. Working closely with Applied AI Engineering and Product teams, you'll help customers embed and deploy AI while uncovering its full range of capabilities in banking, research, and administration. In collaboration with GTM and Marketing teams, you'll continuously refine our value proposition, sales methodology, and market positioning to resonate with Insurance decision-makers and ensure differentiated value across the Insurance landscape.The ideal candidate will have a passion for developing people, identifying market opportunities within Insurance, and executing strategies to capture them. By leading the deployment of Anthropic's emerging products, you will help Insurance institutions obtain new capabilities while also advancing the ethical development of AI. Responsibilities: Build and lead a high-performing team of Enterprise Account Executives focused on Insurance, providing coaching, mentorship, and guidance to drive team success Develop and implement sales strategies tailored to Insurance procurement cycles and budgeting processes to meet and exceed team revenue quotas Create and maintain accurate forecasts, pipeline management, and reporting while ensuring data integrity in CRM systems Partner with Enablement to develop training programs and resources that accelerate AE ramp time and effectiveness, with specific focus on Insurance buying cycles and decision-making processes Work closely with Applied AI Engineering teams to demonstrate technical capabilities pre-sales and optimize solutions post-sales for financial applications Enable your team to have credible technical conversations about AI applications in Insurance while maintaining appropriate guardrails Build strong partnerships across the organization to drive strategic initiatives within the Insurance sector Identify and execute on new market opportunities and use cases for Anthropic's AI solutions within financial departments, research centers, and administrative offices Help your team navigate complex Insurance stakeholder ecosystems including executives, administrators, IT departments, and procurement offices to build consensus Gather and synthesize customer feedback from financial users to inform product direction and enhance customer experience for Insurance Build and continuously refine the Insurance sales methodology by incorporating learnings into playbooks and best practices You may be a good fit if you have: 15+ years of enterprise sales experience in Insurance technology, preferably driving adoption of SaaS or emerging technologies 5+ years of sales leadership experience, ideally 3+ leading teams within the Enterprise segment focused on Insurance Proven track record of building and leading high-performing sales teams selling into financial institutions, with demonstrated success in coaching and developing AEs Experience establishing and scaling sales processes, tools, and methodologies in fast-growing organizations serving Insurance Strong technical acumen and ability to understand complex AI solutions and their applications in Insurance, with experience enabling teams to have credible technical conversations with financial stakeholders Track record of successful partnership with technical teams throughout the customer journey within financial institutions Deep understanding of Insurance buying cycles, procurement frameworks, and key pain points Demonstrated ability to navigate complex, multithreaded sales cycles across diverse stakeholder groups and drive cross-functional initiatives Experience managing complex enterprise sales cycles within financial institutions and helping AEs secure strategic deals Strong operational rigor in pipeline management, forecasting, and sales metrics specific to Insurance sales cycles Excellent communication skills and ability to build relationships across all levels, from analysts and researchers to senior executives in Insurance Strategic approach to financial market analysis combined with tactical excellence in execution Passion for AI technology and commitment to its safe, responsible development for financial use cases The annual compensation range for this role is below. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. Our total compensation package for full-time employees includes equity and benefits.Annual Salary:$435,000 - $550,000 USDLogistics Education requirements: We require at least a Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience.Location-based hybrid policy: Currently, we expect all staff to be in one of our offices at least 25% of the time. However, some roles may require more time in our offices. Visa sponsorship: We do sponsor visas! However, we aren't able to successfully sponsor visas for every role and every candidate. But if we make you an offer, we will make every reasonable effort to get you a visa, and we retain an immigration lawyer to help with this. We encourage you to apply even if you do not believe you meet every single qualification. Not all strong candidates will meet every single qualification as listed. Research shows that people who identify as being from underrepresented groups are more prone to experiencing imposter syndrome and doubting the strength of their candidacy, so we urge you not to exclude yourself prematurely and to submit an application if you're interested in this work. We think AI systems like the ones we're building have enormous social and ethical implications. We think this makes representation even more important, and we strive to include a range of diverse perspectives on our team.Your safety matters to us. To protect yourself from potential scams, remember that Anthropic recruiters only contact you from @anthropic.com email addresses. Be cautious of emails from other domains. Legitimate Anthropic recruiters will never ask for money, fees, or banking information before your first day. If you're ever unsure about a communication, don't click any links—visit anthropic.com/careers directly for confirmed position openings. How we're different We believe that the highest-impact AI research will be big science. At Anthropic we work as a single cohesive team on just a few large-scale research efforts. And we value impact — advancing our long-term goals of steerable, trustworthy AI — rather than work on smaller and more specific puzzles. We view AI research as an empirical science, which has as much in common with physics and biology as with traditional efforts in computer science. We're an extremely collaborative group, and we host frequent research discussions to ensure that we are pursuing the highest-impact work at any given time. As such, we greatly value communication skills. The easiest way to understand our research directions is to read our recent research. This research continues many of the directions our team worked on prior to Anthropic, including: GPT-3, Circuit-Based Interpretability, Multimodal Neurons, Scaling Laws, AI & Compute, Concrete Problems in AI Safety, and Learning from Human Preferences. Come work with us! Anthropic is a public benefit corporation headquartered in San Francisco. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, optional equity donation matching, generous vacation and parental leave, flexible working hours, and a lovely office space in which to collaborate with colleagues. Guidance on Candidates' AI Usage: Learn about our policy for using AI in our application process

Graduate EngineerOur Frederick, MD business unit is looking to add a Graduate Engineer to their team! Under close supervision, you will development, test, and debug computer software and product hardware with the ongoing guidance and direction from more experienced engineers focused on the deployment of Power Plant Training Simulators using the proprietary 3KEYSOFTWARE® suite of real-time simulation software. You will converts technical data into simulation models for the specific systems assigned and support both domestic and international products/services. Travel to power plant sites with the project team for data collection, project meetings and final system acceptance required, typically, 2-4 weeks of per year.Location: Frederick, MD (onsite)Salary Information: $65,700 - $72,000 annually Please note that the salary range information provided is a general guideline only. Criteria such as the candidate’s qualifications and relevant experience, the scope of the specific position, as well as market and business considerations will be evaluated when extending an offer.We Take Care of Our PeoplePaid Time Off I 401K with Employer Match and Profit Sharing I Health and Wellness Benefits I Learning and Development Opportunities I Referral Program I Competitive Pay I Recognition I Employee Stock Purchase Plan I Inclusive & Supportive CultureYour Challenge: Working in a team of engineers to develop, test, and deliver simulations that accurately match real-world dataSupporting delivery of the simulation product which can include logic and controls, operator interface, and other disciplinesSupport development of technical documentation: Design Specification, User Guides, and Test Procedures.Interacting with power plant operators during testing of the productWhat You Bring:0 – 2 years professional experience.Engineering degree in mechanical, nuclear, or chemical fields.Strong desire to learn a wide variety of engineering disciplines and interact with all facets of engineering design.Background and coursework related to power plants, control systems or software-hardware interfaces considered a bonus.Ability to travel 2-4 weeks of per year.Who We AreOur ValuesEnvironmental, Social and GovernanceWSC, a business of Curtiss-Wright, is a technology driven company with engineering simulation as its core competence. WSC's vision is to provide the Power Industry with innovative, state-of-the-art, simulation technology products and services, that will add value  in the design, commissioning, and safe and reliable operation of their power generating or process plant assets.http://nuclear.curtisswright.com/brands/scientech/plant-process-systems/3KEYSOFTWAREhttp://nuclear.curtisswright.com/brands/scientech#LI-TR1No unsolicited agency submittals please.  Agency partners must be invited to participate in a search by our Talent Acquisition Team and have signed terms in place prior to any submittal.  Resumes submitted directly to any Curtiss-Wright employee or affiliate will not qualify for fee payment, and therefore become the property of Curtiss-Wright.  Compliance StatementThis position may require exposure to export-controlled information and subject to additional security screening.  In the event information provided during the security screening reveals ineligibility to access export-controlled information, any offer of employment may be reconsidered or withdrawn. Curtiss-Wright is an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability, age, ancestry, legally protected medical condition, family care status, marital status, religion, veteran status, national origin, or any other legally protected status. If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact Talent Acquisition.For US Applicants: EEO is The Law – click here for more information.If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

The Data Integration Analyst I is responsible for supporting the transformation, configuration, and ingestion of client data files within Allied's insurance tracking systems. This includes translating client requirements into technical specifications, building and maintaining transformation logic, and assisting with validation and troubleshooting. The role contributes to both the initial implementation and ongoing maintenance of lender data configurations and helps ensure accurate, timely, and production-ready data delivery.Job Duties and Responsibilities:Data Transformation and Configuration Setup – 30%Analyze client file formats to extract data requirements and determine transformation needs.Translate business rules and client specifications into detailed source-to-target mapping logic.Configure import profiles and lender setup parameters in the system to ensure compatibility.Document transformation logic using standardized templates for handoff and reference.Perform initial transformation validations to catch formatting or logic inconsistencies.Collaborate with Analyst II and ETL developers to review and finalize complex logic components.Maintain configuration standards and contribute to improving reusable transformation logic.Update and version control mapping documentation as files evolve or rules change.File Validation and Testing – 25%Conduct field-level validation of test files to ensure mappings, formats, and values align with system expectations.Participate in user acceptance testing (UAT) and assist with managing test cases and issue tracking.Review ingestion results and perform root cause analysis on failures or unexpected outcomes.Document validation steps, transformation checks, and test results for future reference.Coordinate with QA Analysts to ensure proper sequencing of test scenarios and confirm expected behavior.Validate backfeed generation and ensure record integrity across inbound and outbound transformations.Track validation progress and escalate blockers to ensure delivery timelines are maintained.Participate in post-testing review meetings to document lessons learned and process improvements.Perform regression testing after configuration changes to ensure no impact to previous logic.Collaborate with Analyst II to validate transformation logic under complex scenarios or overrides.Client Communication and Onboarding Support – 20%Participate in technical onboarding calls to clarify file structures and system mapping requirements.Confirm understanding of client data structures and document assumptions or open questions.Provide professional, client-facing responses to data questions and transformation status updates.Collaborate with Implementation Managers to align onboarding timelines and expectations.Clarify system behaviors for custom or complex logic fields and offer alternatives when necessary.Help clients interpret system validation feedback and revise file formatting as needed.Track communication history and ensure all client logic decisions are documented.Maintain consistent, technically accurate communication with both client and internal teams.Review file content with client contacts and confirm transformation design aligns with their expectations.Communicate risks or edge cases early in onboarding to ensure expectations are managed.Production Support and Issue Resolution – 15%Troubleshoot ingestion failures by reviewing file content, mapping rules, and transformation logs.Respond to helpdesk tickets involving configuration mismatches, invalid data formats, or field logic gaps.Coordinate with Production Support to hand off background on non-standard transformation behavior.Review system monitoring reports and error queues to detect trends in recurring data problems.Update known issues in lender profiles and documentation sites for reference by support teams.Validate post-deployment data imports to confirm production alignment with test results.Assist with file modifications or transformations as client files evolve post-go-live.Escalate persistent issues to Analyst II or QA with documented troubleshooting history.Monitor ingestion health and performance post-launch to detect degradation or latency.Document resolution steps and lessons learned from post-implementation support events.Documentation and Process Improvement – 10%Maintain lender-specific documentation for mapping logic, transformation details, and exception handling.Ensure consistency and completeness in internal documentation repositories.Contribute to internal process documents including configuration walkthroughs and intake guides.Share newly discovered issues and edge cases through team channels or update logs.Participate in team review of standard procedures and propose updates when gaps are identified.Assist in the development and maintenance of standardized templates and review checklists.Provide documentation feedback based on implementation experience to improve clarity and usability.Support onboarding of new team members by sharing reference documents and leading walkthroughs.Document variations in configuration for lenders with custom logic to ensure long-term clarity.Collaborate with QA and other analysts to ensure documentation accurately reflects validated behavior.Qualifications (Education, Experience, Certifications & KSA):Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required.Bachelor’s degree in technical field preferred.Experience in data mapping, file structure analysis, and transformation logic.Familiarity with ETL tools (Informatica or similar).Ability to troubleshoot data file ingestion failures and system configuration mismatches.Proficient in written and verbal communication, especially when working with cross-functional teams.Organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple tasks independently.Ability to understand and edit SQL scripts.Experience in completing technical projects in a collaborative team setting.Experience with retrieving and transforming data from CSV, XML, or JSON files.#LI-ID1The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with a job.We offer our employees a robust compensation package! Our comprehensive benefits include: medical, dental and vision insurance coverage; 100% company-paid life and disability coverage, 401k options with company match, three weeks PTO by the end of the first year and much more. Allied proudly promotes from within as part of a strong commitment to providing career growth opportunities for employees of all levels. Our diverse business portfolio allows employees broad career options with the advantage of staying with the same organization.All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.To view our privacy statement click hereTo view our terms and conditions click here

We are seeking a detail-oriented Data Entry to support data preparation initiatives. This role is responsible for redacting sensitive information from files and reviewing, labeling, and categorizing images to support machine learning model training. Accuracy, confidentiality, and consistency are critical to success in this role. Key Responsibilities: Review digital documents and redact sensitive or confidential information according to established guidelines. Perform accurate data entry and data validation to ensure high-quality datasets. Review, label, and categorize images to support machine learning and AI model training. Follow detailed annotation and redaction standards to ensure consistency. Conduct quality checks to identify errors or inconsistencies. Handle sensitive data with discretion and comply with privacy and security policies. Meet productivity and accuracy benchmarks while managing multiple tasks. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in any field. High attention to detail and ability to work with repetitive tasks while maintaining accuracy. Basic technical proficiency and ability to learn new software tools quickly. Strong organizational skills and ability to meet deadlines. Excellent communication skills and ability to follow instructions. Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information. Benefits: Full-time, permanent position Competitive Salary Stock Option Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Paid time off Sick Days Paid holidays per year Friendly and Learning environment Salary Range: $40,000 - $50,000 About CaseGuard CaseGuard is a software company that helps law enforcement agencies, federal agencies, hospitals, schools, airports, and others manage all their media redaction needs in one easy-to-use redaction software. CaseGuard Studio is one of its kind. Our team is driven by a passion for great software design, the creation of great products, and the creative process, CaseGuard implements innovative ideas across multiple services and agencies. CaseGuard Studio is one of its kind.
